intro: Daphnopsis beta, commonly known as the silverleaf daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Daphnopsis beta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
